Fields.DialogueText: Where've you been, Léopard? I've been looking all over for you!
Oh, my apologies, Capitaine. I thought you knew.
... I suppose I can't begrudge you the occasional catnap amid this chaos.
You tease me, Capitaine - but, respectfully, the place between sleep and wakefulness is a space for creative strategizing. It's nothing you *should* begrudge.
If it works for you and doesn't get in the way of your duties, more power to you.
Merci, Capitaine. Is there a reason for your hasty demand for my presence?

Fields.MenuText: Actually, yes. You're just in time, Léopard... we've got company!
Right. I hope you're well-rested, because it's time to get to work!
Ah, of course. Ready to make some friends?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm always ready, Capitaine!
I can do this in my sleep!
What perfect timing! I was itching for some target practice!
@BATTLE
Pun intended, in case you were wondering.
I started thinking while studying the fleets of Italy and Germany and...  well, that eventually turned into a nap.
Excellent work in your drills today, Léopard.
En fait, oui. As much as I love your company, Capitaine, I'm off to meet with some of the crew for mint tea and kaab el ghazal.
Ahh, your favorites... but how are you thirsty? I see you with a glass of water everywhere you go - you take sips in the middle of battles!
Ha! Maybe that's my real secret. Perhaps I'm drinking from the fountain of youth.
Permission to exit? I'm running late and you know how the crew get when I'm behind schedule.
Well, go on, then - but be back soon. It looks as if we have a few Morganas headed this direction.
Bien sûr, Capitaine!
@BATTLE
Merci! Et vous aussi, Capitaine.
What are you up to now? Heading off to do something more exciting than studying the Italian and German navies?

Fields.MenuText: Excellent. Just as long as you don't have to run to the head every fifteen minutes.
You seem to specialize in exploring unconventional practices - and I mean that as a compliment.
I'm pretty sure steam-desalinated sea water isn't the secret to immortality. Unfortunately.

Fields.DialogueText: It hasn't been a problem so far.
I take it as such!
How can you be sure until you've been at it for a couple of decades?
Hmmm...
Léopard... what's with the pacing? Anything wrong?
Oh, rien. Nothing. Well... I've been thinking about armament improvements.

Fields.MenuText: Really? What did you have in mind?
I think it's unnecessary, but I trust your judgment, Léopard. Let's hear your proposal.
That sounds like a great idea! We need to be at the forefront of technological advances. Let's hear it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you're on the same page. I've been thinking about this for quite some time now and I'm comfortable with what I'm reading here...
This has been on my mind for a long time, so I'm happy you'll hear me out.
Thank you, Capitaine. I've read numerous brochures, manuals, and anything else I can find on these systems.
So, what do you have in mind?
Mostly repairs, and a couple of replacements - staggered over time according to protocol, of course. I think such changes could really make a difference in battle.
You seem to have given this plan a lot of thought. I can reach out to the Protection Force and see if they have any objections. Anything else you'd like to share?
C'est tout, Capitaine!
See, there was no reason to be so worried over a request like that.
Ha! Vous avez raison, bien sûr.
Are you ready for them?
Always!
@BATTLE
I don't have a formal proposal yet, but I do have some notes. If you're interested...?
Of course. Let me just take a quick look...
Again, I'm really impressed by your... restlessness, naps notwithstanding.
Capitaine?
Keep thinking about things, Léopard. Keep finding assumptions to challenge.
I don't think I could stop if I tried. Though the incoming Morganas might slow me down.
How incoming?
Imminent.
Capitaine! We have ships headed this direction!
So we do. Prepare for battle!
Nous sommes prêts!
@BATTLE
A win... but a stressful one. We relied more on luck than I would have liked.

Fields.MenuText: I can see you thinking, Léopard... have something to share?
You and me both.
I'm not one to complain about luck - but if you have other ideas...

Fields.DialogueText: You're rather observant, Capitaine. Well...
I know, Capitaine. It's just... hm.
A sharp eye like yours won't let a thing escape its notice, will it?
Well, spit it out... you have no reason to hesitate. A no is the worst answer I could give you, Léopard.
Please, Capitaine... I ask that you do not mistake my silence for hesitation, but instead see it as what it is - deliberation.
Well, of course. My library is your library - literally, actually.
Merci, Captaine. Look at the time! I must bid you adieu... I'm late for drills.
Permission to carry on.
With that said, I would like a book on defensive strategies. If you'd like me to challenge assumptions, then perhaps I should see exactly what assumptions we have.
All hands on deck!
@BATTLE
Oh, non! Ugh...

Fields.MenuText: By this point, I assume your tardiness is expected.

Fields.DialogueText: It's rude to poke fun at one's fears, Capitaine.
I wasn't - or I didn't mean to be. It's just that you do frequently run behind schedule, and that I assume your companions generally expect it. I know *I've* gotten used to the nap breaks.
Humph... I can be on time! I just need uh... uh... a watch! Oui. That would keep me on time.
I'm sure a watch is attainable. I'll find you one as soon as I can. Or a few... one for each wrist, perhaps.
Now you really are teasing me.
Fair enough. Thank you for humoring me, Léopard.
I'm going to be late meeting up with my comrades again. I hope they're not worried about me.
I'm glad that you're entertained, but this show must move on. I hope my comrades have not decided to leave without me. I could use a drink!

Fields.MenuText: As long as the ship's afloat, I think everyone just assumes you're okay.
I think they'd be more worried if you were on time.

Fields.DialogueText: I told you, I like encouraging unconventional thinking.
Mm-hm.
Léopard? What's on your mind?
Have you ever... thought of what you would want to do once the war is over?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, sure. I think we all do, Léopard.
I generally try to keep my attention on the present day. I think sometimes dreaming does more harm than good.
I do. It would be nice to get back to the way life was... but I wonder if it's possible.

Fields.DialogueText: I think about many things I'd like to do... go out for food and drinks with friends... and taking as many naps as I can!
You know what I'd like to do in the present day? Polish my guns... tell stories of our lives in battle... the list could go on for a while.
The first thing I'd do is locate the most prestigious café that serves the best mint tea, alongside kaab el ghazal...
Sounds pretty good, Léopard.
There's one other thing that I've always wanted to do... with my sisters.
Chacal and Jaguar? What would that be?
Well, we've always wanted to go big game hunting... in Africa. Obviously, that's not a possibility at the moment, but maybe, someday in the future...?

Fields.MenuText: Sorry. And, hey, maybe it *will* be possible one day! You guys are getting stronger all the time...
The three of you out there on safari... that would be a sight.
You know... in a way, we're hunting bigger game right now. But that day will come, Léopard.

Fields.DialogueText: ... One day... one day, indeed!
Yes! It is a dream of mine... of ours. It will happen, I'm sure of it.
Mmhmm, in the blistering heat with my gun... what a thought!
*ALARM*
Well, it looks you've got a chance to put your guns to use! Morganas!
Mmm... bigger game. Oui, c'est assez bien pour le moment!
@BATTLE
The fact that you can't travel too far from the ship itself is kind of a...
Work with me here, Capitaine.
Hmm, yes... that's what I was thinking...
Ooh, let me guess. You were thinking we should try out a new system? Hardware? Or was it that I deserve some leisure?
Not exactly. But if that's a request it's duly noted.
Merci... although, not right now! Enemies are approaching - we must finish this discussion at a later time.
You'd think I'd be used to the interruptions by now.
@BATTLE
Where were we? Ahh, yes... my wishes...
Actually, Léopard, I was muttering to myself and you interjected with what you thought I might be thinking.
Oh, Capitaine... the details hardly matter. But, if you must, tell me what you were thinking. Let's hear it.

Fields.MenuText: You first, Léopard... what were your wishes?
It was nothing... brainstorming, if you will. Now, what was this about your wishes?
My thoughts are still gathering... so how about we chat about it another time? And why don't we talk about that wish list of yours?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, if you'd really like to know...
That is not fair! But you are the capitaine of this ship...
Okay! Since you must know...
Well... what is it?
Hmm, it seems that they've left my mind. Ha, ha, ha... look at that. After all that talking, and fighting, and more talking... I don't remember.
I understand completely. Another time for both of us, then.
And you were basically wrong about all of it, I should add.
You know what I'd like, Capitaine? I want some sweets... perhaps, a sweet I have not tried yet...
Remind me next time we're at port. I'm sure we can find you something new.
Captain?
Have you deciphered our orders yet?
I'm just finishing up, Captain. Ahh, there.
Well, go on!
Right...
We're tasked with carrying out a mission at... well, there are specific coordinates here, but it's basically right by Boulogne-sur-Mer.
Um. A Morgana fleet has been sighted near Boulogne. We're to destroy the immediate threat and to support any and all local defensive programs to the best of our ability.
Thank you. Please, see to it that the crew's informed.
Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I've noted your request for sweets, Léopard - just a reminder that I was listening. Well... let's make preparations for Boulogne.
Very interesting... indeed. Let's get on our way. And Léopard -- I'll make sure your sweets are taken care of.
This shall be a piece of cake... and speaking of cake...

Fields.DialogueText: Merci, Capitaine! But isn't this exciting! A major mission with my sister.
Merci, Capitaine.
Ooo, there are plenty of cakes I've never tried, Capitaine.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hold on - Lieutenant!
Got it. Please continue.
Really?
Well, in a broader sense I think it's worth diversifying our supply lines and getting the crew accustomed to sources of nutrition that might be new to them. This war is global, after all.
Mais oui, I also just want a new snack.
*she stretches*
What are you reading?
Je ne lis pas vraiment. The book is open, but I'm actually in the middle of having an idea.

Fields.MenuText: Really? Would you like to share?
Hmm. If you don't mind sharing...
Huh. Is it something you'd like to say out loud... to me?

Fields.DialogueText: I wasn't planning on it, but perhaps you could help me.
Umm... oui, bien sûr. I could use a second opinion.
Of course, Capitaine. I was going to ask you for your insight.
I was reading up on the Protection Force, and wanted to know if there's information available on specific ships.
Specific? I think I may know which ships you're hoping to read more about... if you don't mind my guessing. The Italians and Germans? I know they've been in the back of your mind for a while.
Oh, Capitaine! You know me too well. We coordinate to a certain extent, but with the land war... well, there are still certain barriers to sharing information between fleets.
You want a better idea of who you're in league with.
Oui, Capitaine. And I would not know where to start my search.
I'll send off a few letters to the Belles themselves, if you'd like. In a war like this, an understanding of one's allies is key.
Merci beaucoup! It would mean so much to me.
@BATTLE
Well, I think that's Calais. We are now officially patrolling the Channel.
Léopard?
Hm?
And I don't like barriers.
All hands on deck!
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I've been talking to the crew, and some of them mentioned their favorite dishes from home.
Is that a fact? What foods were those?
Actually, our conversation focused less on the plats principaux and more on spices.
Spices, eh? I assume you're of the opinion ''the more the merrier'?'
... I do think that unexpected spices can take a simple dish and transform it into a sophisticated delight!

Fields.MenuText: That's one way to look at it! You have that glimmer in your eye... the kind you get when you want something.
Personally, I think spices are overrated. But a search for spices? That could be entertaining.
You're going to make me go out of my way in search of these spices, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, yes, Capitaine. You're quite resourceful at unearthing goods that are hard to find. I'm sure certain spices wouldn't be too difficult for you to track down.
Ah, Capitaine, you're quite intuitive. A search for spices was just what I had in mind.
How can I get anything past you? I suppose we are getting to know each other... I would like to employ your assistance in discovering these spices.
Very well, Léopard. I suppose I do enjoy the occasional side-job... it helps me clear my mind. Do you know what you're looking for?
I have a few spices in mind, but I'm sure I'll hear of more. I'd love to start with saffron. The sailor who spoke of it said it originated in Greece.
I'm guessing this is Lieutenant Ninou? I should warn you that he'd also tell you that Black Forest cake is Greek.
Thank you, Capitaine! One day, perhaps I will cook you a dish!
I'll hold you to it.
But your interest in saffron is duly noted. We'll find some.
Again, if we broaden the crew's palates now, there may be less damage to morale if we find ourselves working predominantly in, say, Asian waters in the future.
Uh-huh.
You wanted me to think creatively!
Uh-huh. So it's not about you being curious.
All hands on deck!
@BATTLE
Terrible! Look how dirty things are in here...
This will never do.
Capitaine! Oh, Capitaine?!

Fields.MenuText: Yes, Léopard? You don't have to yell... I was on my way.
I can hear you just fine! I am nimble, but apparently not nimble enough.
I'm right here! Is something on fire?!

Fields.DialogueText: This is cause for commotion! Look here... do you see what I see?
Oh, Capitaine! Is my distress not apparent?! Can you not see what I see?
Not yet. Isn't the reason I'm in such turmoil obvious?
I'm sorry, Léopard... but what's the problem?
Ugh! My weapons... look!
They've taken some wear and tear. That's to be expected. We're at war, Léopard... your weapons are going to be used.
YES! But not only are they tarnished, but I am also all out of polish. I know that it may seem like a small worry, but it is not. Clean hardware is properly working hardware.
Lieutenant Sande! Can you locate a jar of polish?
Aye-aye, Captain. I believe I saw some in stowage. Permission to retrieve?
Permission granted.
... See, no worries, Léopard.
I thought I looked everywhere... I must have missed the obvious.
Here you are, Captain. It was behind several pallets.
Thank you, Sande. You are excused.
Captain.
Thank you, Capitaine. Have I mentioned that you're wonderful at what you do?
Aren't you supposed to be able to find anything onboard?
If you haven't noticed that I thrive in chaos, I don't know what I can do for you, Capitaine.
... Fair point.
All hands on deck!
@BATTLE
Have you noticed that the lettering on the ship has faded somewhat? Or is it just me?
You have quite an eye, Léopard. I would agree with you.
I don't believe we have any paint, so it should be added to our list of needs.
You're right.
... Sailor, did you get that down? Yes? Good.
It's on the list, Léopard.
I'll run drills with the crew at 10:00 and have some meetings planned with a few comrades later on in the day.

Fields.MenuText: I'll get caught up on some paperwork here.
There are a few things I need to handle here. Then I suppose I'll straighten out my quarters.
Things seem to be calm enough for me to sit out and watch the horizon, I suppose.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... I would love the extra company and expertise for drills. And if you're up for it, you can join my comrades and me. It's good to be around good people... share philosophies, if you will.
Why don't you join me at ten-hundred and show me what you've got? Then, you can sit in on our discussions and see what you think.
Then come with me! I promise it will be worth your while.
I just might take you up on that offer...
If not tomorrow, then another day. You're always welcome, Capitaine.
So, what's on your agenda for tomorrow?
Meetings? Any urgent business I should know about?
They're... more on the order of ancient Greek symposia, really. Sort of an informal way for crew members to introduce new business and new ideas.

Fields.MenuText: Interesting.
... Just tell me there's no alcohol involved.
So it's basically a party.

Fields.DialogueText: And productive! Trust me, Capitaine.
Well, if someone comes by who's technically off-duty and has a wine glass in her hands, we won't kick her out unless she's rowdy. But it's not chaos.
Non, it's productive, Capitaine. Informality breeds inspiration!
Hm.
Et vous, Capitaine? What are your plans?
Capitaine? Remember how I asked you about the spices?
Of course I do. And the saffron's just waiting to be picked up, by the way.
Excellent. Well, I have another spice in mind... as well as something else.

Fields.MenuText: Something else? Like a puppy?
Of course there is... let's hear it, and I'm sure we'll figure something out.
Léopard, I trust your recommendations. Now, out with it.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Not quite. It will be used by the whole ship... it's essential, really.
Once you hear what it is, you'll understand the need!
Oh, Capitaine... let me assure you, it is worth consideration.
I have been thinking about what I will do with the spices that I accumulate... and it makes no sense for them to sit around unused.
I agree. Go on...
A set of cast iron cookware would make the spices rather useful. The aromas a great set would produce... just imagine!
Anyway, what of the new spice you had in mind?
Oh, of course! I heard a comrade talk about paprika! An exotic spice from Hungary. He spoke of the light heat it adds in dishes...
Well, we'll see what we can find in the next ports we visit.
Merci beaucoup. It looks like we have trouble ahead... preparing for battle, Capitaine!
Everyone to your stations!
@BATTLE
... Cast iron cookware?
Capitaine, trust me. It won't cost much, but the impact of food on crew morale can't be underestimated.
That's certainly fair. But I can't help wondering how much of your innovation work you're doing while hungry.
I... don't really understand what you're saying. I'm always hungry, Capitaine. Aren't you?
... Okay, that explains a lot.
What are you doing there, Capitaine?
I'm making my daily entry in my logbook.
A log, you say? Do you find writing every day to be a burden?
Ahh... I can see why such an activity would be helpful.

Fields.MenuText: Have you ever thought about writing? Do you have a journal? A pen?
You should give it a try if you haven't already! Are you in need of pen and paper?
Sometimes our lives on the ship can become rather unconventional. But writing, it keeps me grounded.

Fields.DialogueText: It hadn't crossed my mind, but I am very curious! Unfortunately, however, I don't have a journal. Or a pen.
I would love to start, although I am in need of writing materials.
I'm sure! In fact, I might like to try it myself... if you could... maybe... provide me with pen and paper.
Pen and paper are easy enough to come across, Léopard. Think nothing of it. Any preference in ink color?
Umm... no. Surprise me! Thank you, Capitaine!
It's really a very productive way to spend your time. Think of journaling as a way to practice handwriting, as well as a medium of communication to the world outside of this ship.
I will do that, Capitaine.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: No. Generally, I find it therapeutic.
Yes. Oh, yes. A thousand times, yes. But I've got to keep doing it if I want to keep my job.
No. I mostly just doodle in it, really.

Fields.DialogueText: Or just doodle. Whatever makes sense at the time.
You're shivering! Can we get you a heavier coat, Léopard?
Brr... I-I-I'm f-i-i-ne, C-c-c-apitaine! We are approaching M-o-o-rganas... fifty kilometers at ten-hundred.
@BATTLE
I see that you've warmed up after that battle, Léopard... but we must do something about your coat.

Fields.MenuText: Uh-uh. Keeping you healthy is a big part of my job.
Don't even start! You were cold. We all get cold from time to time... I may have an idea.
Come on. Innovate! Challenge your assumptions!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm fine, Capitaine. I just need to eat more red meat...
You're too worried. I was just idle... everyone gets cold when they're idle.
What did you have in mind? I think you're overreacting, but maybe I am blind to what you're seeing.
Okay, okay! What do you suppose I do?
I mean, the obvious place to start is a fu...
NON! I will not wear a fur coat! Are you kidding me?
Excuse me?
Surely there is some other coat which will suffice. Please, don't make me wear the pelt of some dead animal, Capitaine.
Wait. You were the one who was talking about big game hunting in Africa.
Oui, to be with my sisters!
Hunting big game.
Ah. Non, you see, my goal will be to get close enough to touch them.
A warship against a lone animal in battle? That isn't sport, Capitaine - that's just brutality.
But a challenge of cunning and stealth? One that also allows us to sleep in the sun whenever we like? Ah, it's magnificent!
Honestly, I'd like to try something similar with German and Italian Belles if you-
Nope.
*sigh*
All hands on deck!
@BATTLE
Great work out there.
You too, Capitaine! You know what?
What?
Je suis affamée! I have a craving for something in particular...

Fields.MenuText: Before you say any more, does it require us to go to a different continent?
I'm feeling a bit peckish myself...
Are you hinting at something new, Léopard?

Fields.DialogueText: Well... it's something that isn't on board but is easily found... I'm sure.
I'm glad to hear you've worked up an appetite.
Perhaps...
Let's hear it, then, Léopard. I'm hungry, and I can't help but wonder what you're selling.
Formidable! I have the most horrible craving for shellfish... specifically, shrimp!
That's not too exotic. We should be able to make it happen.
I'd love to cook a meal for us and my comrades. I've got a dish in mind with the spices I've gathered so far.
Will the rest of us need to dress up for this special occasion?
Ha, ha. No... come as you are. It's a gathering for close acquaintances... there's no need to be formal.
Understood. I'll just see to the shrimp, then.
At least you'll be warm in the galley.
Oui.
Ha! Oh, Léopard...
Umm... what?!
Well...
Do I smell?!

Fields.MenuText: Not at all! But if you did, it would likely emanate from your feet.
Have you not noticed this? Don't you feel a bit of a... draft?
Léopard... you don't look down very often, do you?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! What is it?! I don't see anything!
A draft? From where?
Look down? Down where? What are you talking about?
Sorry, but that'll have to wait. Morgana fleet approaching!
@BATTLE
Bien. Back to our earlier topic of conversation.
Right, right. That said, remind me to conduct a few more experiments to see if leaving you waiting on news improves your combat performance. You seemed very motivated back there.
Come on now... be nice.
Look at your shoes, Léopard.
My... shoes? My shoes are... ah. There is a sizeable hole in the left shoe, isn't there? My apologies, Capitaine. I'll have it fixed in no time.
No apologies needed, Léopard. Thank you for your patience. And I could always order you a new pair of boots.
That's kind of you to offer, Capitaine, but I don't mind mending my shoe. Thank you, though, for keeping a close eye on me.
All hands on deck!
@BATTLE
Mangoes... I've never had those before. It's a tropical fruit, you know?
I do. Why are you thinking about mangoes?
A comrade brought them up. Its skin is red and green, and the fruit itself is bright yellow. At least, that's what he told me.
And did he tell you what mangoes taste like?
He couldn't explain their flavor! He said I would have to try one myself to understand.

Fields.MenuText: Well, shall we keep an eye out for one?
Then you shall. No reason that you shouldn't, right?
Mangoes... noted, Léopard!

Fields.DialogueText: Oui! Thank you, Capitaine, for encouraging this personal mission of mine!
Food is such a marvelous way of understanding other cultures. Don't you agree, Capitaine?
Merci, Capitaine! I enjoy your enthusiasm. It motivates my interests... or perhaps, our interests?
Of course. Food does have a tendency to bring people together.
Oui! Exactly!
And, more than that, it's something to live for, Capitaine. One of the worst things about war is that it teaches you to tighten your horizons - to always be "ready" instead of living in the moment.
Anything that can take the crew out of themselves for just a little while, some reminder that happy surprises can still break through the Morgana fog... well, it's good. It's very, very good.
*YAWN*
With permission, I'm going to nap now.
Go ahead. You've more than...
*zzzzzzzzz*
Oh. You meant here.
To your guns!
@BATTLE
Hum...
Hum hum...
Are you humming? I've never heard you hum before...

Fields.MenuText: I have a deep appreciation for classical music, believe it or not.
Only when I'm bored.
It's calming. You'll catch me humming here and there.

Fields.DialogueText: Classical, you say? That's interesting.
What? You don't find my company thrilling?
I can understand that, Capitaine.
You know, I've never listened to much in the way of music. *she stretches* The crew keeps telling me I'm missing out.
No? Well, if you're interested, we ought to get you a phonograph.
Un phonographe? I wouldn't be opposed to that.
Well, we'll see if we can't track one down for you, then.
Are you sure, Capitaine? I don't want you going out of your way for me.
I find I'm actually rather enjoying all the hunting, to be honest.
Sailor! Are the flowers, napkins, and hors-d'oeuvres ready?
Yes, ma'am. Everything is in place and ready. All that we're waiting for now are the people.
Formidable. You have done well. Rest before the festivities, mon brave. I will see you then.
Thank you, ma'am.
Are you excited for the party, Capitaine? I'm hoping it is a success... something to bring joy in such ominous times.
I know the crew is excited for the idea. I think it will be the talk of the fleet.
There was something I was hoping to ask you about... I don't have a dress for the party. I would love to arrive in something suitable for such an event.
But this is so new to me! What do we have? And what would suit me? Do I have a particular color?

Fields.MenuText: Purple would complement your eyes.
I think yellow would match your disposition. Something sunny.
Blue would look quite striking, I'd wager.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! I've never thought that purple was my color - but you make an interesting point!
Yellow? How daring, Capitaine. I'll have to see what I can find.
But a light blue or a dark blue? Hmm... I'll have to give this some thought.
I'm glad I could help. I wish you luck in your search.
*ALARM*
Looks as if I'll have to hold off on the search for a little longer.
@BATTLE
... Are you intentionally giving me the chance to show off here?
Capitaine?
You really don't know?
Non. I don't think so.
So, we established that you needed warmer clothes.
I had hoped you'd forgotten that.

Fields.MenuText: A captain never forgets.
Don't worry, I ruled out fur.
I also got you a watch for each wrist.

Fields.DialogueText: *sigh*
Anyway, we have a few crates' worth of clothes for you to choose from. Anything you don't want can go to civilians in need.
Merci, Capitaine.
All hands on deck!
@BATTLE
Et ne reviens pas!
Heh. You're in a good mood, given the circumstances.
I've been keeping my systems and hardware in good repair... and I'm at a good point right now. I feel like things are going well!
The fact that we're still alive after that last engagement would seem to support you.
But I can't let up now. I need something that will make me even more of a threat to the Morganas...

Fields.MenuText: Like a new pillow?
What are you thinking? Hardware?
Oh, my... should I ask?

Fields.DialogueText: A pillow? Why on earth would you say that?
I am a little embarrassed to say...
I assure you, there's no harm in doing so.
All right then, Léopard. Out with it!
Rouge... I want rouge.
Rouge? ... Why?
You got me thinking about presentation - and I think rouge could help me look more fierce in battle! I wouldn't take it as far as kabuki makeup, but imagine something along those lines!
Well, I don't have any at my immediate disposal, but we will be stopping in port soon.
Excellent...
I mean, I know you can sleep standing up, but...
Ha! No, that's not what I had in mind.
Oh, I know there will be cleaning up to do. But...
It's your own fault.
That's usually true, yes.
So, maybe not just rouge, but a wider array of... face paints?
Peut-être!
All hands on deck!
@BATTLE
How are you doing, Léopard?
Oh, je ne sais pas. I mean, I'm fine, just...

Fields.MenuText: Just what? I mean, that last battle was tougher than many...
Those Morganas really had it out for us.
Is anything bothering you?

Fields.DialogueText: No, no, I'm fine!
I told you... everything is all right. I'm just a little... I don't know.
I said I was fine!
It's apparent that you're bothered, Léopard. I won't press the issue, but I do want you to know that I'm here, ready to talk any time you want to talk.
... These battles just keep going on and on, Capitaine. Who will we be if they never stop? Que ferions nous?

Fields.MenuText: We need to remember why we're fighting. If we stop, the rest of the world doesn't stand a chance. We can't forget that.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, but I was starting to think... never mind, Capitaine.
I was just looking at the makeup you found for me, Capitaine.
I... don't understand.
It was meant to... je ne sais pas... to give women choices. To let them look like the people they want to be.
And there I was, trying to find a way to make a weapon out of it.

Fields.MenuText: We'll still be ourselves. This is never going to be all we are. We won't let that happen.
I know this sounds like I'm changing the subject... but you sound like you could use some sleep.

Fields.DialogueText: You know, Capitaine?
What is it, Léopard?
I really want a pet.

Fields.MenuText: You really think an animal has a place aboard this ship?
Please, Léopard. No pets.
I'll think about it.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, it'll be easy. There's no reason to worry. I'll train it, feed it, water it... everything!
You're worrying unnecessarily. It'll be great for the morale of the crew.
You know you want one, Capitaine. The ship will be better with it.
I suppose you're right. But... we can't have anything that needs round-the-clock care.
A cat. I think our ship would do well with a cat. They could help us combat the mice aboard this ship, and they're independent enough that they wouldn't need to be watched constantly.
All right, all right. I suppose you have a name picked out for one already?
Lynx.
... Don't you have a sister named Lynx?
*ALARM*
It will be fine! You'll see!
@BATTLE
Oui.
What? I like the name!
Capitaine! Do we have the fishing poles, hooks, and lines ready for the event?
Yes! But that'll have to wait... enemy sighted!
@BATTLE
Whew...
Finished, finally.
You were quick to act there, Capitaine...

Fields.MenuText: That's my job, Léopard.
Of course! As captain, my eyes are peeled even as I lay my head to rest!
It seems that I've become attuned to chaos. Unfortunately.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope I have not offended you, Capitaine.
I did not mean any slight by my remarks...
My apologies if I said something I should have kept to myself.
Not at all, Léopard! I apologize if I came across as harsh. Let's head on to the fishing event. Everyone's waiting.
D'accord. Thank you for all of this, Capitaine. The crew is excited... just as I am.
Let's go, before they out-fish us!
To say nothing of Lynx. Helpful reminder: keep the fishing lines with sharp hooks on the end away from the playful cat.
No worries, Capitaine. She and I have spoken extensively about the dangers the ship presents.
... Y'know, I'm just going to accept that as fact.
All hands on deck!
@BATTLE
Whew! I'm so glad that's over. That battle seemed to last forever, didn't it?
It did. You did well out there, Léopard. We did well.
Well, nous sommes une grande équipe. Our enemies don't stand a chance!

Fields.MenuText: As captain and Belle, we're quite the force.

Fields.DialogueText: I agree! Look how far we've come. And in such strides! This is just the beginning...
Well, given that most of your whims have involved feeding the crew and improving morale, I'm not sure thanks are required. Or, if they are, it goes both ways.
Thank you, Capitaine. Your words mean a lot to me. Ack!
What is it?

Fields.MenuText: We're quite the dynamic duo.
I can't imagine my life without that girl.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm late for drills! See you in a bit, Capitaine!
Ha! I should say... you've been very kind to me. Generous with your time, and very tolerant of my whims. I'm not sure I've ever thanked you - not really.

Fields.MenuText: You do know you don't have to sound like a propaganda poster with me, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Non! I really believe it! Capitaine, this is just the beginning of our career of triumph.

Fields.MenuText: You sound like you mean it.

Fields.DialogueText: Bien sûr! And this is just the beginning!
And that doesn't bother you? The "just the beginning" part?
*stretch*
Don't tell me you're still thinking about my moment of weakness the other day.
It's just the sort of thing I remember.
Oui. I know. Your memory is better than mine.
Though part of that is that I have a certain friend who reminds me to look to the future instead of the past.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like a good person to know.
Sounds like some kind of idiot.
Nah. You don't need that kind of reminding. That's just who you are.

Fields.DialogueText: Oui.
Non. Not at all!
I really do believe we're going to win this, you know. And then, somehow, you and your sisters will find a way to sneak up on lions in the veldt. Or whatever it is you want to do.
